result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan-Anthony J Roberson

records.addlTxt:
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Testificandum and Order to Sheriff to transport Eric D. Vaneyck for Jury Trial on 02-28-23 at 8:30 a.m. 
Copy filed.

12:01 PM   Defendant Jordan-Anthony J ROBERSON appeared by video.  Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz appeared by video for Jordan-Anthony J ROBERSON in 21CF243 and 21CF739.  Attorney Luke Harrison appeared by video for Jordan-Anthon J ROBERSON in 22CF264.  Defendant appears on his own behalf in case no. 21 CT106.    Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant wishes to reject any offers previously made by the state and proceed to trial.  Court finds that the Defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently rejects all offers and his cases are set for trial.  
Cases 21CF243, 21CF749 and 22CF264 are scheduled for pretrial and trial dates.  Case no.  21CT106 will follow along with the other cases at this time.  
Scheduling order will be prepared by the Court within the next 1-2 weeks.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 11:15 am.
Review scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 08:20 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 28, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 7, 2022 at 11:40 am.

02:37 PM Defendant Jordan-Anthony J Roberson appeared by video.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Jordan-Anthony J Roberson. 
Preliminary held. Testimony presnted Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Charges in the Information will mirror the charges in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charge contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

2:46 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan-Anthony J Roberson appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim appearing in court with defendant.  Preliminary hearing demanded.  Court sets bail at $1,000.00 recognizance bond.  Defendant refuses to sign recognizance bond.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Re:  Battery by prisoner, on 03-04-22.   
Initial appearance is set for 04-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.
